data.text: You have to pay for a subscription to even view files with this app. Any time I try to open a PDF, I get a "Try Acrobat Premium" message that requires either a subscription purchase or a "free 7 day trial" with credit card info and automatic payment after the 7 days. If I try to close the pop up message or tap the back button, it closes the entire app. In short, the app is useless without a $70/year subscription.

I need a simple workflow - download PDF, open PDF. I installed Adobe because I trust they won't install spyware. EVERY time this app opens, it pops-up ad to try the 7-day premium editing features. No problem, just close the window. But then it doesn't show the file I just downloaded?! THEN, I try to open the file, and it lists them alphabetically with no option to sort by download date. FAIL! I uninstalled.

The app would be great but for the constant nags to try a streamlined reading mode, even if you use it all the time, even including occasional full-screen pop over nags when you just want to open a doc to take a quick peek. In addition, it constantly highlights features that are not available without a paid monthly subscription. This app is basically an advertisement for a paid monthly subscription for features I rarely need. Regretfully uninstalling, as I really like the core functionality.

It's very helpful to be able to choose the information you want to appear on my charts and graphs that reflect my average glucose levels. Plus, I can choose a 2, 7, 14, or 30-day time frame to be reflected on my data charts. All in 30 seconds. I can view this information on Samsung Notes, Acrobat, or several other options. I'm not savvy online, but the Dexcom Clariy App is easy for me to use. My new Dexcom G7 has changed my Diabetes control in positive ways!

Doesn't have a print icon (?!?!?!?!?!) and I can't view layers either. I've already uninstalled it, because honestly, what is the point of this app? It was obviously an afterthought because the Adobe extension for Chrome has more features. Get it together, Adobe--lots of people use Chromebooks now and you should step it up, or take this app off the Play store.

I have been using this reader on my phone for several months now and if this phone had a larger screen I'd be on cloud 9. The app works primarily the same as the software for your desktop or laptop. I am truly interested in checking out the fully armed app and finding out what features that I'm missing out on. I've been dabbling with computers and software since the early 80's and I consider Adobe one of the better software companies.They seem to have a an outstanding quality control department.
data.replyText: Hi there! We are here at your rescue! 🙂 You can learn about the app and see tips & tricks here: (http://adobe.ly/readerfaq) Let us know if you experience trouble with anything. We will love to help you out. Thanks! ^Vaibhav

data.text: Adobe has alway been my favorite PDF software. Until I got a Chromebook. The functionality within Chrome leaves a lot of features out. Since ChromeOS is web based, the features that are available on other platforms should be available on the web based version as well. I find it difficult to complete the same tasks that I can on Windows OS. The app doesn't always work the way I need it to. However, it is still the only PDF software I'd use.
data.replyText: Hi there! Sorry you're having trouble! 😔 Could you please elaborate on your concern so we can help you better? Thanks! 🙂 ^VB

data.text: loved the fact that I had issues with my phone and couldn't find any of my files in my secured folders and then I rememberd that I had Adobe! so I decided to check the status of my account since I hadn't in a very long time and low and behold all my pdf files were there! even ones that I had completely lost before I was able to read them a while back! It opened right up no problems or issues and there they all were! all easy to read and all in order!

I do not like that when I search for a word I have to go through each individual one. It worked better before where you could see each instance and what pages they were on. This makes searching through tma document cumbersome. Another smaller issue is when I click on the page number scroll, I then have to click again to actually enter the page number. Too many steps for a simple function.

It's a PDF reader. I only have one complaint besides pricing for pro: please give us the option to decide if we want this app to hide the devices status bar and clock. Time is important. There is nothing more annoying then swiping down from the top of the screen to check the time when it could just be left alone. It would only take your team 90 seconds or so to fix! Could you imagine the uproar if this was a Windows problem too???

I'm not happy with not being able to use 2 page book view on this app. It says on the website you can for android but instructions that are given don't lead anywhere, it's like I don't have the app their talking about. Some one needs to add this feature. I have a bunch of digital strategy guides I'd like to veiw 2 pages together like a book and with them being digital scans the pages side by side would look best in stead of one page at a time. Other than that the app is cool & works

Be careful! I upgraded to pro for some extra features. It offered a 7 day free trial. It didn't do what I needed, so I cancelled my subscription through Google Play. A month later I get charged a subscription fee. I then go directly to Adobe to cancel and now they're hitting me with an early cancellation fee. Pretty tricky Adobe!
data.replyText: Hi David! Hope you're doing well. Can you please confirm if you were able to get help from our community team? If not, dop an email at acrobat-android-support@adobe.com so we can help you better. Thanks! 🙂^VB

data.text: I love having Acrobat on my phone & computer. Whenever a message pops up wanting me to pick what I want to use to open something I always pick Acrobat and it has never let me down. I'm not the most advanced user but whenever given the option I always go with my old standby that I've used for years and know I can trust. If there is something other apps do that Acrobat can't I'm not aware of it and obviously haven't had a need for it!

Would leave 0 starts if I could. Don't waste your time downloading unless you want to pay $70. If you open a document, you are prompted to do the free trial of the $70 premium version if you decline to it kicks you out completely. I will be uninstalling this app since it has become useless. The seller sends a message saying to just hit the button at the bottom to decline the free trial and use the free version, but there is no button.
data.replyText: Hi there! The free app version lets you view, print, share, comment, and fill & sign on PDF files. You can close the prompt by clicking the "Not Now" button at the bottom. You can see tips & tricks here: (http://adobe.ly/readerfaq). Thanks! ^VB

data.text: Naggy piece of software. Just wanted to use the "name brand" PDF reader to do basic viewing, but Adobe has lost the plot with all the constant notifications and popups about "features". I shouldn't have to tell it a hundred times that no, I don't want to convert an image I just downloaded into a PDF, and no, telling Android to block the notifications doesn't count as a "setting" in your app.
data.replyText: Hey! Thank you for sharing your concern. Since file access permission has been provided by you to Acrobat, we aim to enhance your experience by identifying potential document images and providing an easy way to convert them to PDFs. You can disable these notifications by turning off the ‘Downloads’ channel in your app notification settings. ^VB

data.text: TERRIBLE! DON'T SUBSCRIBE! Signed up for the free trial, tried to cancel and didn't give me the option to, instead uses aggressive marketing and MAKE YOU sign up for the annual subscription. Then, when I tried to cancel, made me go through hoops just to cancel them and charges an early cancelation fee! I never wanted to sign up for the annual subscription in the first place! It is NOT user friendly! They want access to too many files- overly invasive. BEWARE!

This is probably the single most frustrating program which I use multiple times per day within my company. It seems like on a weekly basis, some kind of upgrade (garbage) is being done that changes the way the finished product looks when I turn work into a PDF using Adobe as a "printer." There must be a disagreement between Microsoft and Adobe. Why such a high rating when it must update so regularly, changes settings with/after every update, and fails in some way after any given update?
data.replyText: Hi there! Sorry, you're having trouble! 😔 Could you please elaborate on your concern to our community of experts at: (adobe.ly/readercommunity) so we can help you better? Thanks! 🙂 ^VB

data.text: Just uninstalled. With one of the latest updates, reader started popping up every time I took a picture, offering to save as PDF, could not find an option to turn it off. If I wanted Adobe Reader to look at every photo I take (and I don't) I'd configure it that way. I just want a mobile app that only reads PDF files securely, nothing else.
data.replyText: Hey! Thank you for sharing your concern. Since file access permission has been provided by you to Acrobat, we aim to enhance your experience by identifying potential document images and providing an easy way to convert them to PDFs. You can disable these notifications by turning off the ‘Downloads’ channel in your app notification settings. ^VB

data.text: This is a great app that I have been using for years. However, there seems to have been an issue that has been introduced after the latest update related to the freehand drawing feature. Whenever I note something down using this feature, the entire section of the page that is leftward and downward from the word becomes filled and blocked by that word's box and annotating something different on that page becomes troublesome. Edit: the annotation issue has now been resolved.
data.replyText: Hey! Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Can you please share a test file along with screen recording of the workflow with our developers at acrobat-android-support@adobe.com? You can also contact our community of experts: (adobe.ly/readercommunity) for assistance. We will love to investigate this and help resolve the issues. Thanks!🙂^VB

data.text: (19/05/23) The latest update is worst. Very slow performance. Changing color of underline or highlight takes to much time. The older version of the app was way better. (05/03/23) App crashes when changing color of underline or highlight, without saving the edits. Too irritating. I have to underline and highlight everything again. And to solve this, i have to go back after some time to save the edits and then open and continue editing. Please solve the issue 😢
data.replyText: Hi there! That shouldn't be happening! 🥺 Can you contact our community of experts at (adobe.ly/readercommunity)? We want to investigate what went wrong and help resolve the issues. We're here to help! Thanks! ^VB

data.text: This app can't even be used properly on tablets. The app doesn't give you full landscape view of PDFs. Whenever you try to open a pdf in landscape mode, it's shows just in middle and on both sides there is a gap. Even if you try to zoom, you only see or use middle part of tablet. In simpler words, it's useless. Make a more compatible and user friendly version. And please provide general settings of your App.
data.replyText: Hi there! Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Can you please share a screen recording of the workflow with our developers at acrobat-android-support@adobe.com? You can also contact our community of experts: (adobe.ly/readercommunity) for better assistance. We will love to investigate and help resolve the issues. Thanks! 🙂^VB

data.text: After the recent 28Jan2024 update, there was an issue with the annotation and drawing tool. If I draw something, lift my pen/finger off the screen, and draw somewhere else again, and then turning off the drawing tool, the drawn margins will somehow be at the bottom left of the page. Tried deleting app data, reinstalling, restarting phone.. Nothing worked. I sent an email to the adobe team in Jan2024, gotten a response weeks later, and they fixed it in the 03Mar2024 update!
data.replyText: Hi there! Thank you for bringing this to our attention! Can you please share a screen recording of the workflow with our developers at acrobat-android-support@adobe.com? You can also contact our community of experts (adobe.ly/readercommunity) for better assistance. We would love to investigate and help resolve the issues. Thanks!🙂^VB

data.text: It is good but has minor issues to be fixed. (1) On my tablet, whenever the keyboard turns off bluetooth connection (automatically), the app restarts and I have to pull back the page where I was reading. (2) Also, sometimes I draw with the pen and save the document, the drawing disappears. You can see the note and when you click on it the drawing appears, but when you click on another note the drawing disappears.
data.replyText: Hey! Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Can you please share a test file along with screen recording of the workflow with our developers at acrobat-android-support@adobe.com? You can also contact our community of experts: (adobe.ly/readercommunity) for assistance. We will love to investigate this and help resolve the issues. Thanks!🙂^VB

data.text: my go to pdf viewer. Can you guys make a modification to the columns: 1 colum with ebook name to be bigger in order to display more of the ebook name 2nd and 3rd column resized just enough the date and size or have the option to hide the 2nd and 3rd column as it's not that important. I've tried also on tablet to read the full name of e-books and i see the same issue: the 2nd and 3rd columns with date and size take more space than necessary. Thx.

For a document our government sends for filling out and signing electronically, it gives error message that the document is protected. I just want to fill in the blanks and sign it, and it won't allow me to do that. I don't care if it overlays instead of taking it apart - I don't care about the method, I just want something that works! You can't fill the boxes, you can't sign it. I tried both the [T] and the sign options from the menu. This sucks. I'll use one of the other apps.
data.replyText: Hey! Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Can you please share a test file along with screen recording of the workflow with our developers at acrobat-android-support@adobe.com? You can also contact our community of experts: (adobe.ly/readercommunity) for assistance. We will love to investigate this and help resolve the issues. Thanks!🙂^VB

data.text: Shouldn't be this difficult. I cannot open pdfs with this app, it goes directly to me signing up for premium features, there no x or decline to close that. I've signed in through Google so have no clue why it won't simply open a pdf file on my phone. The help section is way too long. Just going to choose another pdf viewer.

I used to use Adobe Reader on my windows computer but was using other apps on my tablets and phones. I just got a new tablet and downloaded Adobe Acrobat. It's the quickest reader out there for reading drawings and maps. The image is clear and you can pan the image without it going fuzzy. My tablet is a blackview tab 10 which runs Android 13 and has 8GB of RAM.

I love Adobe I once was able to afford to use the edit and writing etc. feature I wish there was a feature that could be used where even if you had to pay a reasonable hrly fee for those of us who can't afford a monthly or annual. I have a 5-6 other less expensive or free ones and either they can't provide the quality of Adobe or I can't figure out how to use it. I think other Adobe products have been duplicated and done well but I have found none that compare to Adobe. Thanks Mark Barmes

Abysmal UX. No matter how many times I delete it, the welcome PDF keeps coming back. I store my PDFs in a location of my choosing, the app keeps copying them to its custom cache folder. PDF view needs a rework. Too many buttons are in the way. We want to read our PDFs not navigate through unwanted buttons. Not to mention the super annoying tips popups that cannot be deactivated. And last but not least, stop annoying users asking for their login credentials.
data.replyText: Hi there! Sorry you're having trouble! 😔 Could you please connect with our community of experts at: (adobe.ly/readercommunity) so we can help you better with all your concerns? Thanks! 🙂 ^VB

data.text: I have always preferred this app it's awesome, but due to the recent updates, some bugs have appeared. sometimes, it's laggy, the contents are vivid, and the copy function works improperly (it copies one word but not the sentence) the app is amazing, and I hope the debugging process takes place cause it's marvelous.

I mostly use the highlight featuere of this app but this feature was working absolutely fine a few weeks ago but now the app frequently crashes when i am highlighting and most of the times lags while using highlight,i don't know if it is due to any new update or any bug in the app. Creators please help I am so fond of this app, so please fix this issue. Thanks

App is utter garbage. It is ugly, poorly laid out, terrible navigation, does not actually recognize or save preferences. Does not retain login information, pop-up "tips" are obnoxious and uncessisary. It is a shame they have a monopoly, I'd prefer nearly anything else.

I've been using Adobe Acrobat Reader for a few years now on my laptop and phone I haven't had much of an issue until recently when I got a new android tablet. The problem lies in the inability to change the interface from the classic interface to the new experience interface. As I was working on Adobe, some sort of glitch or something happened where the interface did chang and when I left the app and went back in, the interface had switched back to the classic interface which is not what I want.

I've been using Adobe Acrobat for some years, however I only just discovered a very amazing feature! It's the comment feature that let's me record my voice in real time and have it saved such that I can go back to it whenever I need it. I now play my voice recordings of my academics papers 🗞️ on the go. Thank you so much Adobe 💕. I won the lottery with you 😁.

it is strange that most of time there are missing text cant show on the the fit the screen size. since when i zoom-in the file some missing text could be present, and when i zoom back the text were disappeared again. i dont know how could it be that, it is adobe not other i dont know app.

I am using Adobe Acrobat reader on my window 11 has been crashing lately after the update, works fine on the phone, but crashes within few seconds or minutes. I haven't faced such issues before the update.

Was fine to begin with but now I can no longer open pdfs from emails. Trying to close the free trial pop-up just closes the app. I also see adobe has bought a ton of fake reviews to try and bury their dodgy subscription antics, do yourself a favour and don't bother with this, they can't be trusted anymore

Speak to management. It's getting annoyingly bad software lately. Constant notifications when monitoring my phone for downloads etc. And not the best reader actually. Display issues and bugs with many older PDF documents. But worst issue is just the constant nagging and bugging to put anything else I do with my phone though Adobe to convert to PDF. Please GO AWAY! Behave yourself Adobe!
data.replyText: Hey! Thank you for sharing your concern. Since file access permission has been provided by you to Acrobat, we aim to enhance your experience by identifying potential document images and providing an easy way to convert them to PDFs. You can disable these notifications by turning off the ‘Downloads’ channel in your app notification settings. ^VB

data.text: Update: Last reviewed in 2022. No issues until recently. For over a month now I've been unable to access the Adobe Acrobat Reader app. I can use the Adobe scan app, I go online to sign into my account using Chrome browser from my phone (LG V30 from Verizon) with no issue. I try using app, the app instantly closes after showing its initial loading screen. I haven't tried uninstall then install it back yet, will try that after posting this then follow up here with result.

I'm generally pleased with this app but I had problems at first with printing single docs then I couldn't even open a manual to a new shredder I had to uninstall and put it back in my phone to read it & other stuff I downloaded a 2nd reader to accomplish that which I'll keep as a backup in case of another digital hissy fit by this program! The latest update remedied my issue ergo, the promotion to five⭐!

Opens to a subscription page which is seems impossible to navigate past so cannot see document. Basically not fit for purpose if we have to use other applications to view a document. Hardly going to pay 10 euros to view someone else's document. Expected better from Adobe.

Really NOT a very good experience, it's fine for viewing PDFs and that's all you can do without upgrading to premium, Liquid mode is seriously so bad!! It needs a lot of improvement, it's not available for most PDFs and for which it's available, it's not working, texts and headings all get mixed up and pictures are not visible.

2024.2.6 No saving button. But it auto save without an undo button and eraser button. I prefer it pop up and ask the user save or not save instead of auto save. 2022.3.30 Too easy to mark many red lines when viewing the documents. But this is the best viewer for showing the QR-code for scanning use. Using other PDF viewers cannot always show the QR-code correctly to scan and causing scanning errors.
data.replyText: Hi there! Thanks for your feedback! 😃 Would love to know if there's anything that we can do to improve your rating. 🙂 ⭐️🤩 -Vaibhav

data.text: Older versions worked better the new app constantly can't open pdfs properly not sure why but it's made working with this app a real pain . Documents dont show information and when sharing a document it posts a copy to the cloud Instead of actually sending a copy to the intended recipient.. seems to be the common trend break something that works .. in pursuit of perfection ..

Worst experience. I was looking for subscription. So here was 7 days free trial. But when I accessed purchase... They took my 340 rs immediately without giving me free trial. Then I cancelled it immediately. But no refund has been initiated yet. It's a trap do not fall into this. Don't go for subscription...

Continues to add "features" that get in the way of actual user experience, like "integrating" with Gmail to open pdfs (when Gmail already prompts the system's pdf viewer, such as Acrobat, to open pdfs), prompting you to reformat your pdf for "easier" viewing even when you don't want it because it's not that kind of pdf, uploading your pdfs to Adobe Cloud when you're happy where they are, and identifying a purchased pdf as "scanned" and attempting OCR on it. JUST LET ME READ IT, ADOBE.

Going from one of the best PDF readers to the worst. Multiple reasons caused me to install another PDF viewer, including - bad if you view large files or schematics. No smooth scrolling but every other PDF reader can do it - no more sharing of PDFs. Even if it's only a 100kb PDF the app upload it to the cloud and shares a link. No more direct attachment to email or only with huge work around. Every other reader can do it. Stop forcing us to everything you guys think
data.replyText: Hi there! Thanks for your feedback. We’ve recently introduced a new share sheet to streamline document sharing. The legacy ‘Send a copy’ option remains in its familiar location at the bottom right, enabling you to share document copies seamlessly. You can learn more and see tips & tricks here: (http://adobe.ly/readerfaq). Thanks! 😊 ^VB

data.text: It would be a worthwhile app if Google wasn't contacting me with their ASININE messages constantly. I mean, is it really necessary for those writing these notifications to utter, "still declined," instead of simply "declined" or, perhaps they could just take the hint that I don't want what they are selling and did NOT, in fact, give them any sort of payment method whatsoever. Third-party Google idiots, once again.

Is Adobe premium and pro two different subscriptions? The files I upload to my account from my phone do not show on the desk top account. Even when I reload the app. I can edit my files on premium version on my phone but the desk top version wants me to subscribe to pro???? And on the desk top version I can see my subscription to premium so what the hell adobe????

Adobe reader is my go to app for any pdf document and I am satisfied with it. My suggestion to the developer would be to add display auto rotate option in the app itself like video media players. Otherwise turning on auto rotate in quick settings for only pdf viewing also applies to all the other apps. That could be irritating because while switching between adobe and other apps the other apps also start auto rotating and you need to again go to quick settings to turn off auto rotate.

Using it with Samsung Tab S9 + (sometimes S23 Ultra). The app is mostly stable and fairly easy to navigate. Some MAJOR issues. Lacks the layout and similarity to Web / PC Version: 1. Biggest issue to me personally: Doesn't have matching colors and as many color options. Working on several platforms and color coding becomes almost impossible... 2. Especially with Tablet → I would want to choose where to have my toolbar. Tools on top is Unergonomic (but down on the phone ?)

Everytime I open a PDF from my e-mail, I have a pro payment plan option that won't dismiss and doesn't allow me to view my work material. No known fix that I've found, just very pushy from the launch of the app. If you have this same issue, Microsoft office allows you to view documents without being locked behind a "try pro edition trial" screen. Issues occurs on my Samsung phone where I donmost of my work, not desktop.

I love the app, but I read a lot of textbooks using the app and it's all fine in the continuous and single page modes but when it comes to reading mode, the text is not aligned properly. If there are two paragraphs on different topics placed side by side, they merge together and I end up reading two completely different paragraphs. Please solve this problem.

Just needed to use it to fill out a pdf form. That was easy but exporting it in to as a pdf on to my phone is non existent. I used the share feature to send the form via email and when it was opened, everything I filled out was all tripled, so it looked messy and each word had shadows. I do not recommend using app.
data.replyText: Hey! Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Can you please share a test file along with screen recording of the workflow with our developers at acrobat-android-support@adobe.com? You can also contact our community of experts: (adobe.ly/readercommunity) for assistance. We will love to investigate this and help resolve the issues. Thanks!🙂^VB

data.text: Very good app I think the best PDF reader There is a list of the files that you have saved in it. In other apps you cannot edit it but on Adobe Acrobat PDF reader you can edit it on this app. You can search any word in the document. It has a feature where you can add a comment and there is liquid mode in which you can see the titles in the file automaticly.It also has PDF maker in which you can click or add photos to make a PDF file Best for schools as there are PDFs that cant be took as pics.

I have attempted on numerous occasions over a period of two years to change my payment date. It deducts on the 15th of every month, which is a problem from my side. Now the new and improved update signs me out when I attempt to use the app until payment is received. Some assistance is needed. I have a lifetime of files I am not willing to lose, plus the app is amazing. If a real human being can make contact with me and assist me in this, that would be great.
data.replyText: Hi there! We're here at your rescue. Can you please share your Adobe ID with us at acrobat-android-support@adobe.com so we can help you better? Thanks! ^VB

data.text: As other reviews mention, after the last update no annotation works properly: highlights disappear, underlining comes and goes, while hand drawing is a nightmare (appears and dissapears randomly, always creates a margin at the bottom left corner). Please fix ASAP, the app is basically bricked when it comes to any annotation.
data.replyText: Hi there! That shouldn't be happening! Can you please share a screen recording of the workflow with our developers at acrobat-android-support@adobe.com? You can also contact our community of experts: (adobe.ly/readercommunity) for better assistance. We will love to investigate what's not working for you and help resolve the issues. Thanks!🙂^VB

data.text: Lately with most new documents I try to read, the text just disappears after touching the screen. I have to close and reopen the document to get the text back but then only the left half of the page is visible and everything disappears again when I touch the screen. This happens on all my android devices

2 stars because it is a WONDERFUL app. Minus three because I don't believe in the overwhelming amount of companies going the subscription model route. This isn't a streaming service. PDF editing and encryption could understandably be paid features, but to make payment reocurring, no ownership own nothing and be happy thing that goes too far. Cloud services and what not I understand. I hope others read this and fight back against the own nothing and subscribe to everything modern business model.

Can not edit pdf. Requires registration, then starting "free trial" with yearly subscription (monthly doesn't do, they want to rip you off right), and then you open the pdf, edit, then press add text or add image and nothing happens. All you can do is insert empty pages. Super useful. 1 star

Use for work as we have a sign in sheet. I use the "Draw" function for signatures. When doing so, that drawing then takes up the entire selection in the page. Not the drawing itself but selection area of the drawing. So if you touch anywhere else on the page, even if it's not the drawing area, it will select the drawing area and it shows that it's taking up the whole page please fix this, can't edit any other part of the page afterwards without clicking "show comments"

Can you please share a test file along with screen recording of the workflow with our developers at acrobat-android-support@adobe.com? You can also contact our community of experts: (adobe.ly/readercommunity) for assistance. We will love to investigate this and help resolve the issues. Thanks!🙂^VB

data.text: As a PDF viewer, it's fine. End of positives. Unfortunately the app has turned into NAG-WARE. ie every efffing time I open a file, it tries to nag me into connecting with a cloud service. Similar every time I take a bleeeping screenshot. "Convert to PDF". Nag nag nag. No thanks, just stop it. Can we turn these nags off through a setting? Pretty much please with sugar on top?

Document reading Is top notch. Navigating in this app is like Android file navigation. It shows only starred files on first page. That's correct, but it does not show easily what files are there on phone. The UI should have been simpler. The delete document option is too complex and time consuming.

This app,downloaded decades ago, first quit letting me name documents (now only possible for about $100/ year: Pro version) Now refuses to let me disable the marketing cookie, so Adobe is selling my info all over the web and will not let me opt out: Error opting out, please try again. (Only possible response: OK.) Trying again for weeks brings the identical result. The page lets me select which of 4 cookies I want to have active, but will only record the Accept All choice. Manage cookies: lies!

A bit of a privacy concern. The app doesn't just need access to your phone storage, but constantly scans your storage. If you download a jpg with a lot of text, for example, you'll be prompted to convert it to a PDF without ever opening the app. Not cool.
data.replyText: Hey! Thank you for sharing your concern. Since file access permission has been provided by you to Acrobat, we aim to enhance your experience by identifying potential document images and providing an easy way to convert them to PDFs. You can disable these notifications by turning off the ‘Downloads’ channel in your app notification settings. ^VB

data.text: I can not be more aggravated with this one. Jump through hoops just to get into the app, having to make a account and confirm through email. Then grant permission without allowing it to get into all my files and do what it will with them. To find out the app is not supported to do what it says it does.

Is it possible to get the veiw settings icon or read mode short cut. in the bottom tray.   I don't like the fact of constantly, have to click many time just to change my view settings. I have different pdf document I view the deffently. Therefore I have to constantly changing the view settings to suite the file.     Please urgently assistant and advise... Or should I source the older version that had the is format?

Acrobat has improved over the years. Rarely, I still hit glitches. one example is when I attempt to print resumés that may be in a template. I end up trying various available functions until it works, or rebooting and starting over. overall, I am almost always happy with Acrobat.

It's fine it is what sometimes though it gets overbearing because files end up in other places where you don't put them and it's hard sometimes to read cuz it goes to a different time of form is it going to get difficult when you got like 100 files you know when you're trying to organize it so once you get organized under the Adobe Acrobat it works it's probably one of the best thanks for making it that's the least amount but it does

my ultimate dream for pdf is to be able to watch videos directly from the PDF along with Gif, Dynamic Graphs, Automatic Animation play directly from within the PDF file no matter what platform I open it on. maybe the file size will be huge but it's functionality should be unlimited.

I downloaded the app specifically because of the liquid mode, which I found very superior compared to a similar functionality from Word, but still it really bummed me that I wasn't able to highlight text while on the mode making it kinda pointless to my purpose.

data.text: Edit2: Thanks for the reply, I did try to close out the log in the first time. Knowing I can get around the log in is good to know for the next time. Edit1: This isn't an Android problem, Reader now requires an Adobe login, which requires almost all of my personal information. It is completely unnecessary to require a login. Original post: Needs personal data, Uninstalling now.
data.replyText: Hi there! You can close the registration screen and open the PDFs. You don't need to log in to use the viewer. However, we would recommend logging in as an Adobe ID helps us deliver a better customer experience by tracking apps and usage, which can be very helpful for troubleshooting issues that might arise. 🙂^VB

data.text: not very user friendly. wish I could sort by date added or modified. or even by filename! but nope. why does this have to be in use order? so hard to track files. easier to use a computer. UPDATE: adobe wrote a response to this, by saying there is a three dot menu with a sort function, but clicking on the three dot only shows 'Select All', 'Grid View' and 'Clear Recent'. What useless CS, all around.
data.replyText: Hi there! If you do not see the file that you want to open, tap the three dots from the top-right corner and then tap Sort by name or Sort by date, as required. Feel free to reach out to our community (adobe.ly/readercommunity) in case you need further assistance. We will love to help you out. Thanks! 🙂 /Vaibhav

data.text: Definitely useful and free. Kind of confusing on how to use though. I just took a scan and sent it to my email and got a completely different document now I'm trying to send that document and I'm having trouble sending it as opposed to sending a link for it.

One of the best applications that I have and I use it everyday. I can fill and sign any form and edit them easily even with my smartphone. I read my articles while the application enhance the quality of the reading. I can't remember when I started using this app and it always works well. Having this app us a must for students, especially university students.
The app is very easy to use and accessible from anywhere. The one drive login doesn't work. It says check internet connection repetitively, in spite of having proper internet connection.

Adobe products are fine, but I don't need a bunch of popups every time I open the app talking about new features. I just want to open a PDF and quickly get some information, not dismiss a bunch of pop ups. Email me if you need to highlight new features.

It's a good pdf reader.But with some of the features that are hid behind a paywall.And with difficulty to try and navigate the app. I still can't find the read aloud option or the search error options but to be honest it still is a decent pdf reader and i will leave it at that.

data.text: Woah! No chance am I paying that ridiculous annual fee. I'll just stick to Microsoft word to be honest with you. I've had over a year of seeing how this works and it's not the best there is for a company that should be above other apps. Don't make it easier to read or options aren't readily available.

I was able to open more than one pdfs at a time earlier in my android phone but after this new update I can't. This is really frustrating as earlier it was easy to get my work done and compare my materials!!! I hope this issue gets fixed since I am not the only one facing this issue!!

Adobe makes it really hard to share the pdf with other apps. It wants you to create an account first before you can share it - I have never seen other app does this. Update: it turned out the function that's usually called "share" in other apps is called "send a copy" in this official app. "Send a copy" lets other apps open the pdf without going through the process of creating an account or emailing.
data.replyText: Hi there! That's correct. We’ve recently introduced a new share sheet to streamline document sharing. The legacy ‘Send a copy’ option remains in its familiar location at the bottom right, enabling you to share document copies seamlessly. You can learn more and see tips & tricks here: (http://adobe.ly/readerfaq). Thanks! 😊 ^VB

data.text: Great pdf viewer and somewhat to editing, but could be better if it shows, where pdf is saved on location to device under each pdf, that could be better. Although, Application is great with extra features compared to others.Moreover, its secure as well.

Not as good as prior versions. This version loses focus and stops rendering large files. Closing and re-opening the PDF "fixes" the problem (until it eventually occurs again). Prior versions did not have this issue.

I had a terrible time getting my order to go through. I called customer service for help and was told I could put in a presidents code toward the end of the ordered, but never found the place to put the code. Gave up on that. There were more hitches in the order process and I finally clicked off of their website. Received an email that the order was being reviewed; I'll see what happens. I'm so tired of that attempt at ordering!

The yearly subscription is too expensive & I'm not sure how I got charged for it. I tried to cancel it but the system is trying to charge me for a whole year when I have not used it & I cancelled it the day it was set to renew and charge for a year. I contacted support but haven't received any help in fixing this yet.
data.replyText: Hi there! To cancel the subscription: Open Google Playstore-Click on the hamburger menu (3 vertical lines on the top left) -Subscriptions-Choose the pack that you want to cancel-Cancel Subscription Feel free to contact our community of experts (adobe.ly/readercommunity) for further assistance. Thanks! 🙂^VB

data.text: It's way too expensive and sometimes difficult to use. Also, I don't like the permissions that you must give it on your chromebook. I will be looking for something else. If someone knows a compatible, yet cheaper one then please leave me the name of it.

I enjoy using this app for reading. However, if certain features like viewing multiple books without closing any. Also, the highlight's tool should be worked on because at times highlighting usually don't work.

Many features I'm aware of yet there's a cost I find is a fault .. "Adobe, on the whole" I've found difficult to contact. Saying this I've since found I'm not to be answered "FULL STOP"🛑 The app is great without need for the yearly £60+ amount? There's other apps I've become aware of which "take for granted" (in my case) I'm loaded .. I don't like the idea of sharing many matters without consent .. (my device has content, without doubt "personal") .. or Wrong I've found .. REASONS ..🧿❓

it has been ruined by adding a pay wall to features that used to be free. Stop it with liquid mode. I have clicked not interested dozens of times. Adobe used to be my go to but these days, it's a constant irritation.

The free app version lets you view, print, share, comment, and fill & sign on PDF files. If a feature you’re trying to use is unavailable or asks you to subscribe, you can try our free trial. Thanks! ^VB

data.text: After opening this will allow me to see what the ins company just sent. It shows my history and wants to show options to pay for monthly subscription. I just want to open it for free since it's only used once in a great while. I have a brand new Galaxy 54 phone that I'm using this on. I was very disappointed.
data.replyText: Hi there! The free app version lets you view, print, share, comment, and fill & sign on PDF files. You can close the prompt by clicking the "Not Now" button at the bottom. You can see tips & tricks here: (http://adobe.ly/readerfaq). Thanks! ^VB

data.text: It does its job of displaying PDFs. It would be nice to have multiple tabs open at the same time, like on the PC version. If you want to follow two recipes at the same time (a main and a side), you have to repeatedly close and reopen the recipe PDFs. Also, I'm a little annoyed at being frequently asked to upgrade to the paid version, which is exorbitantly expensive for a single person who just wants to work with one of the most common digital file formats.
It's a good app. projects my PDFs in good quality. Have never struggled with reading and I like the options of zooming in and out to fit the screen when reading in portrait mode.
